name: Mirage
overview: The map is themed like a Middle Eastern town, but because of its close resemblance to Moroccan style architecture, it is likely set somewhere in Morocco.

name: Inferno
overview: The map is set in a small town with European architecture. In the Global Offensive version, the presence of the Separatist faction suggests that the map is definitely set in Italy, as evidenced by the signs written in Italian seen around the map. However, the separatist faction is also present in the Basque country of Spain and France, so it's plausible it could be there, too.The map is loosely rectangular, with the Counter-Terrorists spawning on one corner of the map and the Terrorists on the diagonally opposite corner, and the two bombsites sitting at the other two corners.

name: Nuke
overview: The map takes place in a warehouse containing nuclear materials or a nuclear power plant. In Global Offensive, the original version of the map takes place a German nuclear power plant, while the revamped version takes place in an American one.Unlike most Counter-Strike bomb defusal maps, the map revolves around a central structure rather than multiple lanes, with the two bombsites being overlapped on top of each other.

name: Overpass
overview: The map's setting is a canal overpass and the park built above it in Berlin, Germany. The GSG-9 must protect a stalled military shipment on a canal overpass while the Phoenix Connexion can either attack the shipment head-on or attempt to destroy the overpass itself by bombing the pillar below.

name: Dust II
overview: The map appears to be set in the Middle East, similar to its predecessor Dust. An earlier version of the map lack many identifying features, with the only identifying features being what looks like sandstone textures for walls and sand for floor.

name: Vertigo
overview: Vertigo is based on a skyscraper that is under construction and centered the conflict between the Counter-Terrorist and the Terrorist teams. The main objective for the Terrorists is to bomb the building while the CTs must prevent them from achieving their goal.

name: Train
overview: As a nuclear payload train is sent to the Железо airport to then be shipped to the Cedar Creek nuclear plant on December 12th 2014. Its route passes through the Next™ train hangar, a Russian railway company that has previously been known for backing corrupt agents from The Coalition for their own gains. The Balkans, a Terrorist faction previously known for their multiple successful operations, has arrived to trap the train station with explosives days before its arrival. Intel suggests that the explosives did not manage to blow the entire station, but only managed to de-rail the nuclear train. On December 10th 2014, the terrorist group takes matters into their own hands and bring up a highly explosive C4 to destroy the place once and for all, but the Counter-Terrorists are here to stop the explosion and defuse the bomb.

name: Cache
overview: The map takes place in Pripyat, Ukraine. The Chernobyl Power Plant is visible from the Terrorist spawn, along with nearby buildings and even fencing material consistent with the real-life counterpart.

name: Cobblestone
overview: Cobblestone is a large-sized map, and had quite significant vertical combat in its earlier iterations. In earlier versions, it is fairly easy to take fall damage due to the high height of many of the map's drops. Bots in early versions of the game will also occasionally fall to their deaths. Additionally, this map is open, making snipers very useful.

name: Ancient
overview: Ancient appears to take place in an archaeological site in the middle of a rainforest (likely in central America). Across the map there are plenty of artefacts such as pots, artworks and monuments which resemble those from the Aztec empire. Each bombsite is referred to as a 'plaza' in the signage and has a distinct theme color. Bombsite A is colored orange, with tarps, paint and signs and Bombsite B is a pale blue color.

name: Agency
overview: The highly polished confines of this modern corporate skyscraper are host to a frantic hostage rescue.

name: Office
overview: It is set in the winter in a office building with parking areas and outside yards. Counter-Terrorists (CT) spawn zone is in a parking garage while the Terrorists are inside the offices. Counter-Terrorists can enter the offices by the front entrance, back hallway or through the glass windows. Near their spawn are rooms which can be used for sniping. There is also a backyard and a hallway at the back of the garage which leads to the offices. This path is connected to the main hallway and leads directly to the Terrorist spawn.

name: Iris
overview: A bomb defusal map set in a small mid-century town that once thrived from its auto-industry. Now anarchists are threatening to blow up the whole town

name: Climb
overview: Due to a recent price increase at the local climbing gym, the terrorists are not too happy. They've subsequently taken desperate measures to be heard. By breaking in and taking 2 members of the management hostage, they hope to see the prices return to normal. The terrorists now pose a threat to anyone trying to visit the climbing gym, so it is up to the local police to stop them..

name: Cannals
overview: Ancient appears to take place in an archaeological site in the middle of a rainforest (likely in central America). Across the map there are plenty of artefacts such as pots, artworks and monuments which resemble those from the Aztec empire. Each bombsite is referred to as a 'plaza' in the signage and has a distinct theme color. Bombsite A is colored orange, with tarps, paint and signs and Bombsite B is a pale blue color.

name: Militia
overview: The map layout is similar to Source but remade completely in some areas for additional cover. It is more balanced for the Counter-Terrorist team, unlike in previous titles when they were easily pinned down by Terrorist snipers.

name: Italy
overview: Ancient appears to take place in an archaeological site in the middle of a rainforest (likely in central America). Across the map there are plenty of artefacts such as pots, artworks and monuments which resemble those from the Aztec empire. Each bombsite is referred to as a 'plaza' in the signage and has a distinct theme color. Bombsite A is colored orange, with tarps, paint and signs and Bombsite B is a pale blue color.

name: Assault
overview: Counter-Terrorists must rescue hostages captured and put into a warehouse by a group of Terrorists. Despite being included in Counter-Strike and Counter-Strike: Source, both versions are noteworthy for their extreme differences. Counter-Strike: Source brought forth a very realistic approach, as well as excluding the Security cameras. Besides taking away the cameras, one of the major changes was the replacement of the highway with the train station. Some players got frustrated with the new changes, however, they are still present in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. Even so, Assault is still one of the most popular maps in all Counter-Strike games.

name: Lake
overview: Lake is a demolition map taking place at a small estate bordering a lake. The Terrorist faction for this map is the Phoenix Connexion and the Counter-Terrorist faction is SEAL Team 6.

name: Baggage
overview: The conflict is occurring in the baggage claim area of a fictional airport somewhere in Germany. The Terrorist faction is the Phoenix Connexion and the Counter-Terrorist faction is the GSG-9..

name: Safehouse
overview: This map was introduced with the original release of the Counter-Strike: Global Offensive beta and is available in Demolition, Arms Race, and Flying Scoutsman modes. In this map, the Terrorists are the Professionals and the Counter-Terrorists are the SWAT team.

name: St. Marc
overview: St. Marc takes place in the coastal port town of Saint-Marc, Haiti, deep in the Caribbean. The Terrorist Pirate faction fight against the Counter-Terrorist GIGN over a truck carrying chemical weapons..

name: Shoots
overview: Shoots takes place somewhere in Vietnam. The Terrorist faction featured are the Pirates and the Counter-Terrorists are the GIGN.Shoots is a symmetrical map. The Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists spawn on opposite sides of the map, with identical cover provided for both sides.

name: Lunacy
overview: This map is placed in a hangar, with a fake roof supposed to represent the moon's sky.

name: Monastery
overview: Monastery is a large, open-spaced an Arms Race map added as part of the October 1, 2012 update. It features the GSG-9 as the Counter-Terrorists, and the Balkans as the Terrorists..

name: Blacksite
overview: The map was created exclusively for the Danger Zone mode. In it, you need to find weapons in order to survive on the map against other 16-18 players. The size of the map to other CS:GO maps is big. The map has bunkers, a hotel, a radio, containers and many other places.

name: Ember
overview: Danger Zone makes a grand return, this time in a once beautiful Portuguese island, which has seen better days.

name: Sirocco
overview: Map actions take place on an abandoned island. This map is very similar in theme to Dust II.

name: Vineyard
overview: Vineyard (dz_vineyard) is a community-created Danger Zone map for designed by Andi, Haaselh0ff, KlixX, Quoting, Seth, Slimek, Squidski and T-R3x3r and is featured in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. The map was added in the February 21, 2022 update.

name: Crete
overview: “A peaceful, summer day on a quiet Greek island becomes the back drop for a close quarters defuse scenario.”

name: Hive
overview: Wingman map set in bees research facility.

name: Shortdust
overview: Shortdust is a modified version of the map Dust, featuring only one bombsite with most of the map cut off. There are also several other changes. Bombsite A has been moved to the interior of the palace and the Terrorist Spawn Zone is located in the underpass.

name: Vineyard
overview: The Danger Zone experiment returns to the sun soaked hills of Tuscany, Italy. Between scenic towns and ancient ruins, fight to survive and be the last man standing.
